description: From German autologisch, from Ancient Greek αὐτός (autós, “self”) + λόγος (lógos, “word”).

entries.meaning: (grammar, of a word, phrase, or especially an adjective) Possessing the property it describes.
examples: The word polysyllabic is autological, but the word monosyllabic is not.
Because the word short is in fact short, it is considered autological.
The word noun is itself a noun, and is thus autological.
